This appears to be an issue with returning null as your children and then 
trying to clear a selection - this should either be specified in the API as 
not allowed or we should check for its validity.

Comment #4 From Tod Creasey:
>This appears to be an issue with returning null as your children and then 
>trying to clear a selection - this should either be specified in the API as 
>not allowed or we should check for its validity.

I take a look in documentation and see that return NULL at getChildren is not 
allow. I changed my code and return a clear object array. But it is not work.

I memory of throws the exception at shutdown time. I tried to set my selection 
only when "newInput" not equals null! That works fine. Think the framework 
calls inputChange with newInput value NULL for clean up.

Thanks for all

Alexander Schneider

re comment #5 - yes, the spec for IContentProvider.inputChanged says: * @param newInput the new input element, or null if the viewer * does not have an input so you should be prepared for null being passed in, and not call anything on the viewer if the input is null. Since this does not appear to be a bug in TreeViewer, I am marking this bug as INVALID.
